label: START
title: KICK OFF
body:
Registration opens on Friday evening — check in, grab your badge, and meet your fellow hackers.

The Opening Ceremony will reveal the hackathon topic for this year. Teams are formed, ideas start flying, and the 52-hour countdown begins!

Make sure you have your development environment ready and your team communication channels set up before the starting gun fires.

label: GATHER
title: TEAM UP & BRAINSTORM
body:
This is your window to align as a team, research the topic, and lock in your project idea.

During the Idea Pitching session you will present your concept to the mentors. Use their feedback early — they are here to help you succeed.

Experienced mentors will be on the floor throughout the event to offer guidance, unblock you, and push your thinking further.

label: HACK
title: BUILD IT
body:
This is the core of HackAUBG — heads down, keyboards out, and bring your idea to life.

You have 52 hours to prototype, iterate, and polish. Use the time wisely: split responsibilities, commit often, and don't forget to eat and sleep.

Mentors are available around the clock. Don't hesitate to ask for help — the best teams ask the most questions.

label: FINISH
title: PRESENT AND WIN
body:
This is the home stretch! You have put in the work and now need to blow the judges away.

Your task consists of creating a presentation for your product, as well as a live Software Demo.

After your presentation there will be a Q&A session with the panel of judges — be ready to defend your decisions.

The grading criteria can be found in the section below. Make sure to check it, as it is extremely important!
